title: Citibank Publishes City of Asuncion Tourism Guide as Part of Celebrations Marking the Bank's 200th Anniversary Around the World
summary: Paraguay's Secretary of Tourism lauds the guide's contribution to the national tourism sector
tag-1: Citibank Publishes City of Asuncion Tourism Guide as Part of Celebrations Marking the Bank's 200th Anniversary Around the World
tag-2: Paraguay's Secretary of Tourism lauds the guide's contribution to the national tourism sector
tag-3: Asunción, Paraguay – Citibank officially presented "laCiti," a bilingual (Spanish and English) pocket guide with tourist information about the Asunción metropolitan area, featuring monthly listings of cultural events and activities, including music, theater, dance and art.
tag-4: "laCiti" is intended to orient visitors to an increasingly dynamic capital that is evolving at its own pace but keeping up with globalization. Three thousand copies of the guide will be distributed each month, presenting Asunción as a lively and growing urban area. Listings will feature the Citi Design Route, with information about stores and businesses offering the best in Paraguayan and international design, and the Citi Gourmet Route, with tips about where to sample the flavors of the city.
tag-5: The cover of the guide will showcase drawings of the capital's architectural jewels by Paraguayan artists, with an eye toward historic preservation. The first issue features scenes of Asunción's Panteón de los Héroes and Oratorio de la Virgen by artist Adri Peralta.
tag-6: "We are grateful to Citi for this valuable contribution to the tourism industry in Paraguay," Tourism Minister Liz Cramer remarked at the "laCiti" launch presentation. "This is a top-quality guide that will be very useful to visitors by highlighting the rich and varied possibilities for tourism available in Asunción, a capital that is emerging as an international destination with many pleasant surprises for visitors."
tag-7: Cramer concluded by congratulating Citi, noting that her office has officially designated the "laCiti" guide to be of national interest to the country's tourism sector.
tag-8: "Citi is celebrating 200 years of its worldwide operations with initiatives designed to offer our clients and community innovation and exclusivity," Citi General Manager Jerónimo Nasser noted. "With this guide, we hope to promote Asunción as a center for development and culture, helping to drive the growth of the businesses and other agents who contribute to the dynamism of our capital's tourism industry."
tag-9: "laCiti" will be distributed free every month at the Citi Cultural Center; the international airport's Citi VIP Lounge; stores and businesses on the Gourmet and Design Routes; and other sites, such as Senatur, cultural centers and hotels. Free copies will also be available to Citibank clients.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
